critique: This document is an executive order adding land to the Ocala National Forest and Game Refuge. It cites existing legislation as its authority. There's no indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, executive power expansion, or impacts on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to be a routine administrative action related to land management and conservation. Therefore, most axes should be neutral. The federalism aspect is slightly towards federal control as it expands a national forest.
